tit.cmt: 原文に合せて訂正しました。

sen.j: 温泉卵（おんせんたまご）は、半熟卵の一種で、卵黄部分は半熟、卵白部分は半凝固状態に茹でた鶏卵。
sen.e: Onsen eggs (onsen tamago) are a type of soft boiled egg, or chicken eggs with the yoke soft and the white only half done.
Onsen eggs (onsen tamago) are a type of soft boiled egg, or chicken eggs with the yoke soft and the white only half done.
Onsen tamago (onsen eggs) are a type of soft boiled egg, or chicken eggs with the yoke soft and the white only half done.
sen.cmt: 読みを先にして、訳を括弧に入れました。

sen.j: 一部では温度卵（おんどたまご）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: There are also soft boiled eggs called 'ondo tamago.'
There are also soft boiled eggs called 'ondo tamago.'
There are also soft boiled eggs called 'ondo tamago.'

sen.j: また、鶏卵を温泉の蒸気で蒸したり、湯でゆでたりしたゆで卵は、その状態にかかわらず温泉卵と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Also, eggs which have been steamed in the steam of hot springs (onsen) or boiled in the hot water are called onsen tamago regardless of whether they are hard or soft.
Also, eggs which have been steamed in the steam of hot springs (onsen) or boiled in the hot water are called onsen tamago regardless of whether they are hard or soft.
Also, eggs which have been steamed in the steam of hot springs (onsen) or boiled in the hot water are called onsen tamago regardless of whether they are hard or soft.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Outline
Outline
Outline

sen.j: 通常の半熟卵とは逆に、卵黄よりも卵白が柔らかい状態なのが特徴。
sen.e: In contrast to the usual soft boiled egg, the characteristic of the onsen tamago is that the egg white is softer than the egg yoke.
In contrast to the usual soft boiled egg, the characteristic of the onsen tamago is that the egg white is softer than the egg yoke.
In contrast to the usual soft boiled egg, the characteristic of the onsen tamago is that the egg white is softer than the egg yoke.

sen.j: これは卵黄の凝固温度（約70℃）が卵白の凝固温度（約80℃）より低い性質を利用して作られるもので、65～68℃程度の湯に30分程度浸けておくことで、この状態になる。
sen.e: This is because they are cooked in water that is between 65～68℃ for thirty minutes, to take advantage of the fact that the temperature at which the yoke hardens ((70℃) is lower than the temperature at which the egg white hardens (80℃).

This is because they are cooked in water that is between 65～68℃ for thirty minutes, to take advantage of the fact that the temperature at which the yoke hardens ((70℃) is lower than the temperature at which the egg white hardens (80℃).

This is because they are cooked in water that is between 65 - 68℃ for 30 minutes, to take advantage of the fact that the temperature at which the yoke hardens (70℃ is lower than the temperature at which the egg white hardens 80℃).
sen.cmt: ～をハイフンに訂正し、スペースを補足しました。数字に訂正しました。不要な括弧を削除しました。

sen.j: 湧出する温泉の湯温がこの範囲に近い場合、これに浸けておくだけで出来ることから、温泉地の旅館などで食卓に提供されることが多く、「温泉卵」の名で呼ばれるようになったと思われる。
sen.e: If the water temperature of water gushing from a hot spring is close to this range, the onsen eggs can be made just by placing eggs in the spring water, so they are often served at hotels in hot spring(onsen) resorts and this is thought to be the origin of the term onsen egg.

If the water temperature of water gushing from a hot spring is close to this range, the onsen eggs can be made just by placing eggs in the spring water, so they are often served at hotels in hot spring(onsen) resorts and this is thought to be the origin of the term onsen egg.

If the water temperature of water gushing from a hot spring is close to this range, the onsen eggs can be made just by placing eggs in the spring water, so they are often served at hotels in hot spring (onsen) resorts and this is thought to be the origin of the term onsen egg.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: あらかじめ殻を割って器にとり、出汁と醤油をあわせた出汁醤油をかけて供されることが多い。
sen.e: They are often cracked and put in a bowl with dashi (stock) and soya sauce.
They are often cracked and put in a bowl with dashi (stock) and soya sauce.
They are often cracked and put in a bowl with dashi (stock) and soya sauce.

sen.j: また、麺類、丼物などのトッピングとしても利用される。
sen.e: They are also used as a topping for noodle dishes and donburi dishes (fish or meat and vegetables served on rice).
They are also used as a topping for noodle dishes and donburi dishes (fish or meat and vegetables served on rice).
They are also used as a topping for noodle dishes and donburi dishes (fish or meat and vegetables served on rice).

sen.j: 生卵を含めた他のどの調理状態よりも消化吸収に優れている。
sen.e: They are far more digestible than eggs cooked in any other way.
They are far more digestible than eggs cooked in any other way.
They are far more digestible than eggs cooked in any other way.

sen.j: 専用の「温泉卵製造機」が市販されているが、保温性のある発泡スチロール容器などを利用して作ることもできる（家庭での作り方参照）。
sen.e: Specialized 'Onsen egg cookers' are available however they can be made by using a container that retains heat such as a polystyrene container(see 'How to make onsen eggs at home').
Specialized 'Onsen egg cookers' are available however they can be made by using a container that retains heat such as a polystyrene container(see 'How to make onsen eggs at home').
Specialized 'Onsen egg cookers' are available however they can be made by using a container that retains heat such as a polystyrene container (see 'How to make onsen eggs at home').
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: また、保温状態の炊飯ジャーを利用し水を使わずに作ることも可能である。
sen.e: They can also be made without using water, by using a rice cooker on the warm setting.
They can also be made without using water, by using a rice cooker on the warm setting.
They can also be made without using water, by using a rice cooker on the warm setting.

sen.j: 半熟卵の名称で一部の外食産業（吉野家など）で出回っている温泉卵は、キユーピー株式会社が製造販売している「キューピットのたまご」という製品である。
sen.e: The onsen eggs on sale at some restaurants (such as Yoshinoya) under the name soft boiled egg are products called 'Cupid's eggs' manufactured by Q.P.Corporation.
The onsen eggs on sale at some restaurants (such as Yoshinoya) under the name soft boiled egg are products called 'Cupid's eggs' manufactured by Q.P.Corporation.
The onsen eggs on sale at some restaurants (such as Yoshinoya) under the name soft boiled egg are products called 'Cupid's eggs' manufactured by Q.P.Corporation.

sen.j: 半熟卵と同じく、卵が新鮮でなければ、食中毒を起こす可能性がある。
sen.e: Like soft-boiled eggs, onsen eggs may be a source of food poisoning if the eggs are not fresh.
Like soft-boiled eggs, onsen eggs may be a source of food poisoning if the eggs are not fresh.
Like soft-boiled eggs, onsen eggs may be a source of food poisoning if the eggs are not fresh.

tit.e: Onsen eggs in hot spring resorts
Onsen eggs in hot spring resorts
Onsen eggs in hot spring resorts

sen.j: 鶏卵を温泉の湯でゆでたり蒸気で蒸したりしたものは、その状態にかかわらず（半熟状ではなくても）温泉卵と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Chicken eggs boiled in hot spring water or steamed in the hot spring steam are called onsen eggs regardless of whether they are soft or hard boiled.
Chicken eggs boiled in hot spring water or steamed in the hot spring steam are called onsen eggs regardless of whether they are soft or hard boiled.
Chicken eggs boiled in hot spring water or steamed in the hot spring steam are called onsen eggs regardless of whether they are soft or hard boiled.

sen.j: 多くの温泉地で、店頭などで温泉の蒸気や湯で調理する様子を実演しながら販売する温泉卵が名物となっている。
sen.e: At many hot spring resorts, shops demonstrate the cooking of onsen eggs in hot spring steam or water and the onsen eggs are sold as specialties.
At many hot spring resorts, shops demonstrate the cooking of onsen eggs in hot spring steam or water and the onsen eggs are sold as specialties.
At many hot spring resorts, shops demonstrate the cooking of onsen eggs in hot spring steam or water and the onsen eggs are sold as specialties.

sen.j: 塩化物泉の場合は，卵自体に塩味が染みこんでいることも多い。
sen.e: If the onsen has a high level of sodium chloride the eggs will often taste salty.
If the onsen has a high level of sodium chloride the eggs will often taste salty.
If the onsen has a high level of sodium chloride the eggs will often taste salty.

sen.j: 福島県福島市の飯坂温泉の温泉卵は、この温泉で日本で初めてラジウムの存在が確認されたことに因み、ラジウム玉子（ラヂウム玉子）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The onsen eggs of Iizaka hot springs in Fukushima City, Fukushima Prefecture are called radium eggs as it is the first onsen in Japan at which the presence of radium was detected in the water.
The onsen eggs of Iizaka hot springs in Fukushima City, Fukushima Prefecture are called radium eggs as it is the first onsen in Japan at which the presence of radium was detected in the water.
The onsen eggs of Iizaka hot springs in Fukushima City, Fukushima Prefecture are called radium eggs as it is the first onsen in Japan at which the presence of radium was detected in the water.

sen.j: 箱根温泉の大涌谷や、後生掛温泉の名物となっている温泉卵の外観は真っ黒である。
sen.e: The specialty eggs of Owakudani hot springs in Hakone and Goshogake hot springs are black.
The specialty eggs of Owakudani hot springs in Hakone and Goshogake hot springs are black.
The specialty eggs of Owakudani hot springs in Hakone and Goshogake hot springs are black.

sen.j: これは卵の殻に温泉成分の鉄分が結びつき黒く見えるものである。
sen.e: This is because the iron in the hot springs turns the egg shells black.
This is because the iron in the hot springs turns the egg shells black.
This is because the iron in the hot springs turns the egg shells black.

sen.j: 黒い部分は殻だけで、中身は普通のゆで卵と同じである。
sen.e: It is only the shells that are black, and the inside of the egg is the same as a normal boiled egg.
It is only the shells that are black, and the inside of the egg is the same as a normal boiled egg.
It is only the shells that are black, and the inside of the egg is the same as a normal boiled egg.

sen.j: 湯村温泉 (兵庫県)の源泉「荒湯」は日本一高温の温泉（98℃）で湯沸し不要。
sen.e: The source of the hot springs of Yumura hot springs (Hyogo Prefecture) is the hottest spring water in Japan (98℃) and it does not need to be heated up.
The source of the hot springs of Yumura hot springs (Hyogo Prefecture) is the hottest spring water in Japan (98℃) and it does not need to be heated up.
The source of the hot springs of Yumura hot springs (Hyogo Prefecture) is the hottest spring water in Japan (98℃) and it does not need to be heated up.

sen.j: 10分程度で温泉卵が出来上がる。
sen.e: The onsen eggs can be cooked in ten minutes.
The onsen eggs can be cooked in ten minutes.
The onsen eggs can be cooked in 10 minutes.

sen.j: 訪れた人の多くが生卵を荒湯につける。
sen.e: Most people who visit put a raw egg in the Arayu spring water.
Most people who visit put a raw egg in the Arayu spring water.
Most people who visit put a raw egg in the Arayu spring water.

sen.j: 雲仙温泉では地獄谷からでる蒸気で蒸し器を使う少し硫黄のにおいがするゆで卵である。
sen.e: At Unzen hot springs, eggs are available which have a slightly sulfurous smell and have been cooked in a steamer using steam from Jigokudani valley.
At Unzen hot springs, eggs are available which have a slightly sulfurous smell and have been cooked in a steamer using steam from Jigokudani valley.
At Unzen hot springs, eggs are available which have a slightly sulfurous smell and have been cooked in a steamer using steam from Jigokudani valley.

sen.j: 付属の塩は普通の塩ではなく、温泉でできた塩を使っている。
sen.e: The salt added is not the usual salt but salt made from the hot springs.
The salt added is not the usual salt but salt made from the hot springs.
The salt added is not the usual salt but salt made from the hot springs.

sen.j: ラムネ (清涼飲料)と一緒に食べる人が多い。
sen.e: Most people drink Ramune lemonade (soft drink) when eating the eggs.
Most people drink Ramune lemonade (soft drink) when eating the eggs.
Most people drink Ramune lemonade (soft drink) when eating the eggs.

tit.j: 別府地獄めぐりの温泉卵
tit.e: Onsen eggs of Beppu Jigoku Meguri (Beppu Hell Tour)
Onsen eggs of Beppu Jigoku Meguri (Beppu Hell Tour)
Onsen eggs of Beppu Jigoku Meguri (Beppu Hell Tour)

sen.j: 別府温泉の別府地獄めぐりの各地獄では卵を温泉で蒸したり茹でたりした温泉卵が名物となっている。
sen.e: Each of the Jigoku spring areas on the Beppu Jigoku Meguri (Beppu Hell Tour) of Beppu hot springs has specialty onsen eggs which are steamed or boiled in the hot spring water.
Each of the Jigoku spring areas on the Beppu Jigoku Meguri (Beppu Hell Tour) of Beppu hot springs has specialty onsen eggs which are steamed or boiled in the hot spring water.
Each of the Jigoku spring areas on the Beppu Jigoku Meguri (Beppu Hell Tour) of Beppu hot springs has specialty onsen eggs which are steamed or boiled in the hot spring water.

sen.j: 温泉の蒸気熱を利用した地獄釜で蒸す地獄蒸し卵の他、別府地獄めぐり海地獄では、98度のコバルトブルーの温泉に、竹籠に入れた卵を直接浸してゆでた、地獄ゆで卵が名物となっている。
sen.e: Apart from jigoku steamed eggs which are steamed in a stone steamer which utilizes steam from a hot spring, at Umi jigoku hot springs on the Beppu Jigoku (Hell) Tour, the specialty is jigoku boiled eggs which are eggs that have been put in bamboo baskets and put directly into the 98℃ cobalt blue hot springs.

Apart from jigoku steamed eggs which are steamed in a stone steamer which utilizes steam from a hot spring, at Umi jigoku hot springs on the Beppu Jigoku (Hell) Tour, the specialty is jigoku boiled eggs which are eggs that have been put in bamboo baskets and put directly into the 98℃ cobalt blue hot springs.

Apart from jigoku steamed eggs which are steamed in a stone steamer which utilizes steam from a hot spring, at Umi jigoku hot springs on the Beppu Jigoku (Hell) Tour, the specialty is jigoku boiled eggs which are eggs that have been put in bamboo baskets and put directly into the 98℃ cobalt blue hot springs.

tit.e: How to make onsen eggs at home
How to make onsen eggs at home
How to make onsen eggs at home

sen.j: 保温性のある発泡スチロール容器（カップヌードルの容器など）に卵を入れ、熱湯を加える。
sen.e: Put an egg into a polystyrene container (such as a cup noodle container) that will retain heat and add hot water.
Put an egg into a polystyrene container (such as a cup noodle container) that will retain heat and add hot water.
Put an egg into a polystyrene container (such as a cup noodle container) that will retain heat and add hot water.

sen.j: 熱湯は卵が隠れるまで入れる。
sen.e: Put in just enough hot water to cover the egg.
Put in just enough hot water to cover the egg.
Put in just enough hot water to cover the egg.

sen.j: ふたをして30～40分程度そのまま放置しておく。
sen.e: Put a lid on and leave it for 30 to 40 minutes.
Put a lid on and leave it for 30 to 40 minutes.
Put a lid on and leave it for 30 to 40 minutes.

sen.j: なお、冷蔵庫から取り出した卵に急に熱湯をかけると割れてしまうので、熱湯を入れる前にぬるま湯などである程度卵を暖めておくと良い。
sen.e: If you suddenly cover an egg which has just been taken out of the refrigerator with hot water it will crack, so it is a good idea to warm up the egg a little first in warm water before putting in the hot water.

If you suddenly cover an egg which has just been taken out of the refrigerator with hot water it will crack, so it is a good idea to warm up the egg a little first in warm water before putting in the hot water.

If you suddenly cover an egg which has just been taken out of the refrigerator with hot water it will crack, so it is a good idea to warm up the egg a little first in warm water before putting in the hot water.

sen.j: また、20～25分間70～75度に湯の温度を保って卵を茹でれば温泉卵はでき、容器に拘る必要はないが沸騰や温度の降下に至らないように工夫する要領が要る。
sen.e: Furthermore, if you boil an egg for 20 to 25 minutes at between 70 to 75 degrees, you can make an onsen egg without the necessity for a container, however it is necessary to have a way of maintaining the boiling and temperature.

Furthermore, if you boil an egg for 20 to 25 minutes at between 70 to 75 degrees, you can make an onsen egg without the necessity for a container, however it is necessary to have a way of maintaining the boiling and temperature.

Furthermore, if you boil an egg for 20 to 25 minutes at between 70 to 75 degrees, you can make an onsen egg without the necessity for a container, however it is necessary to have a way of maintaining the boiling and temperature.

sen.j: また、ペーパードリップ式のコーヒーメーカーを使って作ることもできる。
sen.e: Also, it is possible to make an onsen egg using a paper drip type coffee machine.
Also, it is possible to make an onsen egg using a paper drip type coffee machine.
Also, it is possible to make an onsen egg using a paper drip type coffee machine.

sen.j: サーバーに生卵を入れ、フィルターペーパーとコーヒー豆をセットせずに通常のドリップを行うだけというシンプルなものである。
sen.e: This is a simple way as you just put a raw egg into the coffee pot and turn it on without adding the filter paper or coffee beans.
This is a simple way as you just put a raw egg into the coffee pot and turn it on without adding the filter paper or coffee beans.
This is a simple way as you just put a raw egg into the coffee pot and turn it on without adding the filter paper or coffee beans.

sen.j: この方法でも冷え切っている卵を使うとひびが入るので、あらかじめ常温にしておく方がよい。
sen.e: Even with this method, if the egg is cold it will crack so it is a good idea to let it return to room temperature.
Even with this method, if the egg is cold it will crack so it is a good idea to let it return to room temperature.
Even with this method, if the egg is cold it will crack so it is a good idea to let it return to room temperature.

sen.j: 吉野家が2003年頃からメニューに「半熟玉子」という名前で温泉玉子を追加した。
sen.e: Yoshinoya added onsen eggs to its menu in 2003 under the name soft boiled egg.
Yoshinoya added onsen eggs to its menu in 2003 under the name soft boiled egg.
